name: Shawshank Redemption
stars: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton
review: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

name: The Godfather
stars: Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan
review: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

name: The Godfather: Part II
stars: Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall
review: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

name: The Dark Knight
stars: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart
review: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

name: 12 Angry Men
stars: Henry Fonda, Lee J. Cobb, Martin Balsam
review: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.

name: Schindler's List
stars: Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes, Ben Kingsley
review: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
genre: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
stars: Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen
review: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

name: Pulp Fiction
stars: John Travolta, Uma Thurman, Samuel L. Jackson
review: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

name: Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo
stars: Clint Eastwood, Eli Wallach, Lee Van Cleef
review: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
stars: Elijah Wood, Ian McKellen, Orlando Bloom
review: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

name: Fight Club
stars: Brad Pitt, Edward Norton, Meat Loaf
review: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soapmaker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.

name: Forrest Gump
stars: Tom Hanks, Robin Wright, Gary Sinise
review: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the events of Vietnam, Watergate, and other historical events unfold through the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

name: Inception
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Ellen Page
review: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O.

name: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
stars: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher
review: After the Rebels are brutally overpowered by the Empire on the ice planet Hoth, Luke Skywalker begins Jedi training with Yoda, while his friends are pursued by Darth Vader and a bounty hunter named Boba Fett all over the galaxy.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
stars: Elijah Wood, Ian McKellen, Viggo Mortensen
review: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

name: The Matrix
stars: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss
review: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.

name: Goodfellas
stars: Robert De Niro, Ray Liotta, Joe Pesci
review: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.

name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
stars: Jack Nicholson, Louise Fletcher, Will Sampson
review: A criminal pleads insanity and is admitted to a mental institution, where he rebels against the oppressive nurse and rallies up the scared patients.

name: Shichinin no samurai
stars: Toshirô Mifune, Takashi Shimura, Keiko Tsushima
review: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.

name: Se7en
stars: Morgan Freeman, Brad Pitt, Kevin Spacey
review: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.

name: Cidade de Deus
stars: Alexandre Rodrigues, Leandro Firmino, Matheus Nachtergaele
review: In the slums of Rio, two kids' paths diverge as one struggles to become a photographer and the other a kingpin.

name: La vita è bella
stars: Roberto Benigni, Nicoletta Braschi, Giorgio Cantarini
review: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor, and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

name: The Silence of the Lambs
stars: Jodie Foster, Anthony Hopkins, Lawrence A. Bonney
review: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

name: It's a Wonderful Life
stars: James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore
review: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

name: Star Wars
stars: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher
review: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the mysterious Darth Vader.

name: Gisaengchung
stars: Kang-ho Song, Sun-kyun Lee, Yeo-jeong Jo
review: A poor family, the Kims, con their way into becoming the servants of a rich family, the Parks. But their easy life gets complicated when their deception is threatened with exposure.

name: Saving Private Ryan
stars: Tom Hanks, Matt Damon, Tom Sizemore
review: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

name: Sen to Chihiro no kamikakushi
stars: Daveigh Chase, Suzanne Pleshette, Miyu Irino
review: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.

name: The Green Mile
stars: Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse
review: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift.

name: Interstellar
stars: Matthew McConaughey, Anne Hathaway, Jessica Chastain
review: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.

name: Léon
stars: Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman
review: Mathilda, a 12-year-old girl, is reluctantly taken in by Léon, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. An unusual relationship forms as she becomes his protégée and learns the assassin's trade.

name: The Usual Suspects
stars: Kevin Spacey, Gabriel Byrne, Chazz Palminteri
review: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which began when five criminals met at a seemingly random police lineup.

name: The Lion King
stars: Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, James Earl Jones
review: A Lion cub crown prince is tricked by a treacherous uncle into thinking he caused his father's death and flees into exile in despair, only to learn in adulthood his identity and his responsibilities.

name: American History X
stars: Edward Norton, Edward Furlong, Beverly D'Angelo
review: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.

name: The Pianist
stars: Adrien Brody, Thomas Kretschmann, Frank Finlay
review: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

name: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
stars: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Edward Furlong
review: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her teenage son, John Connor, from a more advanced and powerful cyborg.

name: Back to the Future
stars: Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Lea Thompson
review: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent thirty years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the eccentric scientist Doc Brown.

name: Modern Times
stars: Charles Chaplin, Paulette Goddard, Henry Bergman
review: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

name: Psycho
stars: Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles
review: A Phoenix secretary embezzles forty thousand dollars from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

name: Gladiator
stars: Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Connie Nielsen
review: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

name: City Lights
stars: Charles Chaplin, Virginia Cherrill, Florence Lee
review: With the aid of a wealthy erratic tippler, a dewy-eyed tramp who has fallen in love with a sightless flower girl accumulates money to be able to help her medically.

name: The Intouchables
writer: Olivier Nakache, Philippe Pozzo di Borgo
stars: François Cluzet, Omar Sy, Anne Le Ny
review: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

name: The Departed
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson
review: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.

name: Whiplash
stars: Miles Teller, J.K. Simmons, Melissa Benoist
review: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

name: The Prestige
stars: Christian Bale, Hugh Jackman, Scarlett Johansson
review: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.

name: Once Upon a Time in the West
stars: Henry Fonda, Charles Bronson, Claudia Cardinale
review: A mysterious stranger with a harmonica joins forces with a notorious desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.

name: Casablanca
stars: Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Paul Henreid
review: A cynical American expatriate struggles to decide whether or not he should help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape French Morocco.

name: Joker
stars: Joaquin Phoenix, Robert De Niro, Zazie Beetz
review: In Gotham City, mentally troubled comedian Arthur Fleck is disregarded and mistreated by society. He then embarks on a downward spiral of revolution and bloody crime. This path brings him face-to-face with his alter-ego: the Joker.

name: Rear Window
stars: James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Wendell Corey
review: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.

name: Nuovo Cinema Paradiso
stars: Philippe Noiret, Enzo Cannavale, Antonella Attili
review: A filmmaker recalls his childhood when falling in love with the pictures at the cinema of his home village and forms a deep friendship with the cinema's projectionist.

name: Alien
stars: Sigourney Weaver, Tom Skerritt, John Hurt
review: After a space merchant vessel receives an unknown transmission as a distress call, one of the crew is attacked by a mysterious life form and they soon realize that its life cycle has merely begun.

name: Apocalypse Now
stars: Martin Sheen, Marlon Brando, Robert Duvall
review: A U.S. Army officer serving in Vietnam is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god.

name: Raiders of the Lost Ark
stars: Harrison Ford, Karen Allen, Paul Freeman
review: In 1936, archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones is hired by the U.S. government to find the Ark of the Covenant before Adolf Hitler's Nazis can obtain its awesome powers.

name: Memento
stars: Guy Pearce, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano
review: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

name: The Great Dictator
stars: Charles Chaplin, Paulette Goddard, Jack Oakie
review: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.

name: The Lives of Others
stars: Ulrich Mühe, Martina Gedeck, Sebastian Koch
review: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.

name: Django Unchained
stars: Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio
review: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.

name: Paths of Glory
stars: Kirk Douglas, Ralph Meeker, Adolphe Menjou
review: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

name: The Shining
stars: Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Danny Lloyd
review: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.

name: WALL·E
stars: Ben Burtt, Elissa Knight, Jeff Garlin
review: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

name: Det sjunde inseglet
stars: Max von Sydow, Gunnar Björnstrand, Bengt Ekerot
review: A man seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.

name: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
stars: Peter Sellers, George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden
review: An insane general triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a War Room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

name: Oldeuboi
stars: Min-sik Choi, Ji-Tae Yoo, Hye-jeong Kang
review: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.

name: Witness for the Prosecution
stars: Tyrone Power, Marlene Dietrich, Charles Laughton
review: A veteran British barrister must defend his client in a murder trial that has surprise after surprise.

name: V for Vendetta
stars: Hugo Weaving, Natalie Portman, Rupert Graves
review: In a future British tyranny, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of V, plots to overthrow it with the help of a young woman.

name: Once Upon a Time in America
stars: Robert De Niro, James Woods, Elizabeth McGovern
review: A former Prohibition-era Jewish gangster returns to the Lower East Side of Manhattan over thirty years later, where he once again must confront the ghosts and regrets of his old life.

name: Aliens
stars: Sigourney Weaver, Michael Biehn, Carrie Henn
review: Ellen Ripley is rescued by a deep salvage team after being in hypersleep for 57 years. The moon that the Nostromo visited has been colonized, but contact is lost. This time, colonial marines have impressive firepower, but will that be enough?

name: American Beauty
stars: Kevin Spacey, Annette Bening, Thora Birch
review: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

name: Braveheart
stars: Mel Gibson, Sophie Marceau, Patrick McGoohan
review: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.

name: Das Boot
stars: Jürgen Prochnow, Herbert Grönemeyer, Klaus Wennemann
review: The claustrophobic world of a WWII German U-boat; boredom, filth and sheer terror.

name: Amadeus
stars: F. Murray Abraham, Tom Hulce, Elizabeth Berridge
review: The life, success and troubles of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, as told by Antonio Salieri, the contemporaneous composer who was insanely jealous of Mozart's talent and claimed to have murdered him.

name: Reservoir Dogs
stars: Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen
review: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

name: Inglourious Basterds
stars: Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger, Eli Roth
review: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

name: Good Will Hunting
stars: Robin Williams, Matt Damon, Ben Affleck
review: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

name: 2001: A Space Odyssey
stars: Keir Dullea, Gary Lockwood, William Sylvester
review: After discovering a mysterious artifact buried beneath the Lunar surface, mankind sets off on a quest to find its origins with help from intelligent supercomputer H.A.L. 9000.

name: Requiem for a Dream
stars: Ellen Burstyn, Jared Leto, Jennifer Connelly
review: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep.

name: Vertigo
stars: James Stewart, Kim Novak, Barbara Bel Geddes
review: A former police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with a hauntingly beautiful woman.

name: M - Eine Stadt sucht einen Mörder
stars: Peter Lorre, Ellen Widmann, Inge Landgut
review: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt.

name: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
stars: Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Tom Wilkinson
review: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories.

name: Citizen Kane
stars: Orson Welles, Joseph Cotten, Dorothy Comingore
review: Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance; 'Rosebud'.

name: Jagten
stars: Mads Mikkelsen, Thomas Bo Larsen, Annika Wedderkopp
review: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent little lie.

name: Full Metal Jacket
stars: Matthew Modine, R. Lee Ermey, Vincent D'Onofrio
review: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

name: North by Northwest
stars: Cary Grant, Eva Marie Saint, James Mason
review: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies.

name: A Clockwork Orange
stars: Malcolm McDowell, Patrick Magee, Michael Bates
review: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.

name: Snatch
stars: Jason Statham, Brad Pitt, Benicio Del Toro
review: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

name: The Kid
stars: Charles Chaplin, Edna Purviance, Jackie Coogan
review: The Tramp cares for an abandoned child, but events put that relationship in jeopardy.

name: Ladri di biciclette
stars: Lamberto Maggiorani, Enzo Staiola, Lianella Carell
review: In post-war Italy, a working-class man's bicycle is stolen. He and his son set out to find it.

name: Singin' in the Rain
stars: Gene Kelly, Donald O'Connor, Debbie Reynolds
review: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

name: Scarface
stars: Al Pacino, Michelle Pfeiffer, Steven Bauer
review: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel and succumbs to greed.

name: Taxi Driver
stars: Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster, Cybill Shepherd
review: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action by attempting to liberate a presidential campaign worker and an underage prostitute.

name: Amélie
stars: Audrey Tautou, Mathieu Kassovitz, Rufus
review: Amélie is an innocent and naive girl in Paris with her own sense of justice. She decides to help those around her and, along the way, discovers love.

name: Metropolis
stars: Brigitte Helm, Alfred Abel, Gustav Fröhlich
review: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.

name: Jodaeiye Nader az Simin
stars: Payman Maadi, Leila Hatami, Sareh Bayat
review: A married couple are faced with a difficult decision - to improve the life of their child by moving to another country or to stay in Iran and look after a deteriorating parent who has Alzheimer's disease.

name: Incendies
stars: Lubna Azabal, Mélissa Désormeaux-Poulin, Maxim Gaudette
review: Twins journey to the Middle East to discover their family history and fulfill their mother's last wishes.

name: L.A. Confidential
stars: Kevin Spacey, Russell Crowe, Guy Pearce
review: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen -- one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy -- investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.

name: Heat
stars: Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer
review: A group of professional bank robbers start to feel the heat from police when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.

name: Casino
stars: Robert De Niro, Sharon Stone, Joe Pesci
review: A tale of greed, deception, money, power, and murder occur between two best friends: a mafia enforcer and a casino executive, compete against each other over a gambling empire, and over a fast living and fast loving socialite.

name: Raging Bull
stars: Robert De Niro, Cathy Moriarty, Joe Pesci
review: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, whose violence and temper that led him to the top in the ring destroyed his life outside of it.

name: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
stars: Jason Flemyng, Dexter Fletcher, Nick Moran
review: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.

name: The Wolf of Wall Street
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill, Margot Robbie
review: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

name: No Country for Old Men
stars: Tommy Lee Jones, Javier Bardem, Josh Brolin
review: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.
